complexityScore.fieldDescription: Please provide label for Complexity Score
complexityScore.name: ./complexityScore

complexityScoreNotAvailable.name: ./complexityScoreNotAvailable
complexityScoreNotAvailable.value: Complexity score cannot be calculated due to unavailable spectral signature data for some fluorochromes. See fluorochromes tab for details.

popupMessageSubtitle.name: ./popupMessageSubtitle
popupMessageSubtitle.value: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce in quam nisl. Nulla faucibus mattis sapien

popupMessageContent.name: ./popupMessageContent
popupMessageContent.value: Similarity scores indicate how similar two dyes are to each other (based on cosine similarity). Lower numbers indicate that dyes are very different from each other and can likely be used with minimal risk of spillover spreading, while higher numbers indicate higher spectral overlap and increased potential for spillover spreading. Although technically possible, the use of combination with very high similarity should be limited to the design of very large panels and/or when reagent availability is a restriction. The calculated values are dependent on the cytometer configuration and settings used. Complexity score is a single numerical score assigned to a panel based on the specific set of dyes and the cytometer configuration. It is a qualitative measurement that provides information about the overall similarity of dyes used within a panel. The lower the number, the lower the overall spread will be and vice-versa. The smallest number is 1 and grows based on the numbers of dyes in your panel and how similar the dyes are to one another. Panels containing more colors will inherently have a higher score than panels containing fewer.

exportImgbutton.fieldDescription: Please provide lablel for Export Image Button
exportImgbutton.name: ./exportImgbutton
